tags: its been said but i needed to say it again
summary: I feel like you can’t point out Eve’s lack of empathy and growing familiarity with the dark side of herself without mentioning...
body:
I feel like you can’t point out Eve’s lack of empathy and growing familiarity with the dark side of herself without mentioning the fight with Niko, obviously the slap, and how he really is calling her out for having such a big ego. He’s making valid points, valid criticism, which is important to remember, but he’s also doing it because she’s not doing what he expects. She’s not acting safe, to preserve her own life, his life, and their marriage. She’s acting like a different person, someone he’s only seen glimpses of while they read together, discussing murder and her passion for assassins, but he’s never seen her fully for who she is. She’s either kept it hidden as a way to fit in, or never had the opportunity to fully express it until Villanelle handed her the key to that door, or he just outright ignored it. 

As much as I think Niko is inoffensive and just a bystander in this elaborate chase/seduction scenario that Villanelle and Eve have created, it really is a commentary on how little Niko, and in turn, the audience, really knows about Eve. 

My critiques on inattentive husband-ing aside, it is vital that Eve’s character gets explored eventually. I desperately need a “why” for who Eve is, ‘cause Villanelle is easy. With the bare-bone file and basic facts from Anna we’ve been given, it’s easy to surmise trauma and poor well-being in V’s childhood. What about Eve? Was she always like this? Who are her parents? I feel like this stuff might not be talked about much in season 2, and Niko certainly doesn’t know, so I might as well ask the questions now.

trail.content:
I feel like you can’t point out Eve’s lack of empathy and growing familiarity with the dark side of herself without mentioning the fight with Niko, obviously the slap, and how he really is calling her out for having such a big ego. He’s making valid points, valid criticism, which is important to remember, but he’s also doing it because she’s not doing what he expects. She’s not acting safe, to preserve her own life, his life, and their marriage. She’s acting like a different person, someone he’s only seen glimpses of while they read together, discussing murder and her passion for assassins, but he’s never seen her fully for who she is. She’s either kept it hidden as a way to fit in, or never had the opportunity to fully express it until Villanelle handed her the key to that door, or he just outright ignored it. 

As much as I think Niko is inoffensive and just a bystander in this elaborate chase/seduction scenario that Villanelle and Eve have created, it really is a commentary on how little Niko, and in turn, the audience, really knows about Eve. 

My critiques on inattentive husband-ing aside, it is vital that Eve’s character gets explored eventually. I desperately need a “why” for who Eve is, ‘cause Villanelle is easy. With the bare-bone file and basic facts from Anna we’ve been given, it’s easy to surmise trauma and poor well-being in V’s childhood. What about Eve? Was she always like this? Who are her parents? I feel like this stuff might not be talked about much in season 2, and Niko certainly doesn’t know, so I might as well ask the questions now.

summary: bill why would you follow her
rust gathers in the creases of your palm, lodges under your fingernails too late to prevent the cut too powerless to heal it but...
caption:
rust gathers in the creases of your palm, lodges under your fingernails too late to prevent the cut too powerless to heal it but maybe you can stop the flow (we’ve fought so long, cut so deep maybe we can’t fix this fracture – still, i’m sorry)
and there’s blood on both our hands blood, like nails.
Katherine Forster

summary: Soooo can we NOT start shipping Jodie and Sandra together? Leave the actors and their personal lives/relationships alone....
body: Soooo can we NOT start shipping Jodie and Sandra together? Leave the actors and their personal lives/relationships alone. Friendship wise? Yes, OTP, whatever, but it’s not cool to actively ship people IRL. In fact the number 1 rule of fandom is and always has been to NOT SHIP THE ACTORS! It’s fucking weird as shit. You don’t know these people in real life, you know their characters. You know the little parts of themselves that they put out in interviews and in the public eye. You have no idea what relationships they have behind closed doors and until they decide to share that information, you have no right to speculate anything about them or ship them with anyone. Real life shipping is gross and very invasive and it needs to fucking stop. Jodie would absolutely lose her shit and probably avoid social media for a long ass time if she knew people were out here publicly doing this. Not to mention, Sandra has a boyfriend and by shipping them in real life it completely invalidates her actual relationship. Have some respect for the actors and their private lives please?

summary: I wrote her this love letter that was a little bit over the top, but she wrote back to me and said, ‘I want to talk about your...
text: I wrote her this love letter that was a little bit over the top, but she wrote back to me and said, ‘I want to talk about your heart, your vagina and your ideas.’ She said, ‘When I work with women, I want to live in their vagina for the year.’ I was like, ‘The door is wide open, Sandra, please come running in. Welcome.’
source: Phoebe Waller-Bridge about Sandra Oh (via Elle)

summary: Killing Eve resumen de episodio 1x08 "God, I'm Tired "
title: Killing Eve resumen de episodio 1x08 "God, I'm Tired "
body:
Killing Eve resumen de episodio 1×08 “God, I’m Tired “

¡Por fin nos toca hablar del último episodio de la primera temporada de Killing Eve señoras! Que además, tengo que decir, es también uno que nos trajo mucha alegría y drama lesbicanario. Vamos, que es un bollodrama en toda regla. ¿Listas para para la acción? ¡Pues vamos allá!

Nuestro episodio comienza con Villanelle e Irina gritándose. Irina es la hija de Konstantine y tiene tanta o más mala…

summary: do you know who really pissed me off in killing eve? villanelle's teacher. like everything about her. especially the fact that...
body: do you know who really pissed me off in killing eve? villanelle’s teacher. like everything about her. especially the fact that she lied about sleeping with villanelle and all round the details of their relationship. She tries to paint V in a bad light. like yeah she shouldn’t have killed her husband but for fucks sake why did you let your relationship get so far!! with a student none-the-less!!! UGH!

  • I…no. Big no no. Just a thing plaything a weapon whatever not a human being huh
  • Hot cake big no
  • It’s about having fun while getting your job done girl
  • Just shoot man
  • Group project is no fun
  • Frank. What are you doing.
  • ??? For real??? Man you are so going to get killed by both of them
  • Oxana. Oh Nadia
  • …make sure the target is dead is like assassin 101, right? Or because you don’t really kill her?
